Quote: If an electric train is traveling south, then which way is the smoke going?
What goes through cities and fields, but never moves?
It has keys, but no locks. It has space, but no room. You can enter, but can’t go inside. What is it?
I make a loud sound when I’m changing. When I do change, I get bigger but weigh less. What am I?
What 2 things can you never eat for breakfast?
What kind of room has no walls, door or windows?
I have no life, but I can die. What am I?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
When it is alive we sing, when it is dead we clap our hands. What is it?
What is always in front of you, but can’t be seen?
What kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
What has hands but cannot clap?
I add 5 to 9 and get 2. The answer is correct, so what am I?
Who makes it, has no need of it. Who buys it, has no use for it. Who uses it can neither see nor feel it. What is it?
Who has married many women but was never married?
A tree doubled in height each year until it reached its maximum height over the course of ten years. How many years did it take for the tree to reach half its maximum height?
What 3 numbers give the same result when multiplied and added together?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
If you multiply this number by any other number, the answer will always be the same. What number is this?

If a zookeeper had 100 pairs of animals in her zoo, and two pairs of babies are born for each one of the original animals, then (sadly) 23 animals don’t survive, how many animals do you have left in total?
What is 3/7 chicken, 2/3 cat, and 2/4 goat?
Rachel goes to the supermarket and buys 10 tomatoes. Unfortunately, on the way back home, all but 9 get ruined. How many tomatoes are left in a good condition?
If 2 is company and 3 is a crowd, what are 4 and 5?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What goes up, but never comes down?
Which fish costs the most?
I am easy to lift, but hard to throw. What am I?
What is more useful when it is broken?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What 5-letter word typed in all capital letters can be read the same upside down?
What has many hearts but no other organs?
What building has the most stories?
What has words, but never speaks?
What has hands, but can’t clap?
What flowers are kissable?
What is harder to catch the faster you run?
What goes up and down but doesn’t move?
Where does today come before yesterday?
What runs around the whole yard without moving?
What has many keys but can’t open a single lock?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
What has legs, but does not walk?
Which month has 28 days?
What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
What tastes better than it smells?
What goes up but never comes down?
What has ten letters and starts with gas?
Which letter of the alphabet has the most water?
What has a neck but has no head?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
What word is pronounced the same if you take away four of its five letters?
. A man goes out in heavy rain with nothing to protect him from it. His hair doesn’t get wet. How does he do that?
What word in the dictionary is spelled incorrectly?
You see me once in June, twice in November, and not at all in May. What am I?
What do you throw out when you want to use it but take in when you don’t want to use it?
Until I am measured, I am not known. Yet how you miss me, When I have flown. What am I?
Two fathers and two sons are in a car, yet there are only three people in the car. How?
Take one out and scratch my head, I am now black but once was red. What am I?
